testimonials.title: What Our Travelers Say
testimonials.subtitle: Real stories from people who explored Rio with us. Over 1,000 happy travelers back us up.

1.name: Maria Garcia
1.text: An incredible experience! The guide was very professional and knowledgeable. The tour to Christ the Redeemer and Sugarloaf exceeded all my expectations. 100% recommended.

2.name: Carlos Rodriguez
2.text: The trekking to Pedra da Gavea was challenging but the views are stunning. The guide took care of us the whole time and taught us about the local flora. I'll be back for more adventures!

3.name: Ana Martinez
3.text: The yacht ride was spectacular! We watched the sunset from the sea with Copacabana in the background. Perfect for celebrating our anniversary. The crew was very attentive.

4.name: Diego Flores
4.text: The helicopter tour was the most incredible thing I've done! Seeing Christ the Redeemer from above and Rio's beaches is a priceless experience. Spectacular photos.

5.name: Carolina Sanchez
5.text: The beaches of Arraial do Cabo are a hidden paradise. Crystal clear water, amazing snorkeling and the boat crew was super friendly. A perfect day at sea.

6.name: Roberto Diaz
6.text: The favela tour completely changed my perspective. The culture, street art, music... and the views from Vidigal are out of this world. Highly recommended.

7.name: Patricia Morales
7.text: We did the trekking to Morro Dois Irmaos and the views of Ipanema and Leblon from the top are unforgettable. Very professional guide and perfect pace to enjoy.

8.name: Fernando Castro
8.text: The complete City Tour is the best way to see Rio in one day. We visited all the iconic spots and the guide told us fascinating stories about each place.

9.name: Lucia Hernandez
9.text: Prainha and Grumari are paradise beaches! Far from mass tourism, clean waters and postcard landscapes. The beach tour was our best decision.

10.name: Miguel Torres
10.text: We celebrated my wife's birthday on the VIP yacht and it was magical. Champagne, sunset, music and Rio's lights in the background. First class service.

11.name: Valentina Ruiz
11.text: Ilha Grande is a paradise! The boat ride took us to secret beaches with turquoise waters. The fresh seafood lunch was delicious. Unforgettable day.

12.name: Andres Vargas
12.text: Pedra do Telegrafo has the best Instagram photos! The trekking is accessible and the coastal views are spectacular. Excellent and very patient guide.

13.name: Camila Reyes
13.text: Seeing Rio from the helicopter at sunset was surreal. The colors of the sky, the illuminated Christ and the whole bay shining. An experience worth every penny.

dayTour.title: Day Tour Rio de Janeiro
dayTour.description: Discover the best of Rio in a single day. We visit between 7 to 9 tourist spots, including Christ the Redeemer, Selaron Steps, Sugarloaf Mountain, Leblon Viewpoint and much more. A complete experience that will allow you to know the most emblematic icons of the marvelous city.

items.0: Hotel pickup and drop-off or meeting point

items.1: Historical and cultural explanation at each stop

0.question: What is the best time of year for this tour?
0.answer: Rio de Janeiro has tropical weather year-round. We recommend April to October to avoid heavy summer rains. However, any time is good to visit.

1.question: Do I need to bring extra money?
1.answer: We recommend bringing $30-50 USD for personal expenses like souvenirs, extra snacks or tips. Lunch is not included but there are excellent options along the route.

2.question: Can children or elderly people travel?
2.answer: Yes, the tour is suitable for all ages. We have comfortable vehicles and the pace adapts to the group. For people with reduced mobility, check availability of accessible routes.

3.question: What should I bring?
3.answer: Comfortable clothing, sunscreen, hat or cap, camera and comfortable walking shoes. In summer, bring insect repellent.

4.question: What is the cancellation policy?
4.answer: Free cancellation up to 48 hours before the tour. Cancellations with less than 48 hours have a 50% charge. No shows are non-refundable.

favelasTour.title: Favela Tour
favelasTour.description: Experience the authentic Carioca culture with guided tours through Rio's most famous favelas. Learn about their history, their people and their impressive viewpoints. An experience that will change your perspective on these vibrant communities full of art, music and tradition.

items.2: Interaction with local artists and merchants

items.0: Part of the cost supports community projects

0.question: Is it safe to visit the favelas?
0.answer: Yes, our tours are completely safe. We work with local guides who know the community perfectly and maintain established routes. The safety of our visitors is a priority.

1.question: Can I take photos?
1.answer: Yes, you can take photos of landscapes and street art. We ask for respect and always ask permission before photographing residents. Your guide will advise you on best practices.

2.question: What is the best time of year for this tour?
2.answer: This tour can be done year-round. Mornings tend to be quieter and have better light for photos. Avoid days of heavy rain.

3.question: What should I bring?
3.answer: Comfortable and discreet clothing, closed walking shoes, little cash and avoid flashy jewelry. Bring water and sunscreen.

4.question: Are there vegetarian options in the tasting?
4.answer: Yes, let us know in advance about dietary restrictions and we'll adapt the gastronomic experience to your needs.

playasTour.title: Beach Tour
playasTour.description: Explore the most iconic beaches: Copacabana, Ipanema, Joatinga, Prainha and Grumari. Ideal for enjoying the sun, surfing, natural landscapes and spectacular photos. Discover the hidden gems of Rio's coastline with its crystal-clear waters and postcard landscapes.

items.1: Free time to swim and relax
Umbrella and chairs at main beaches

0.question: What is the best time of year for this tour?
0.answer: From November to March is summer in Rio with ideal beach temperatures. However, from April to October there are also excellent days with fewer crowds.

1.question: Do I need to know how to swim?
1.answer: Not mandatory, but recommended. Some beaches have currents, always follow the guide's instructions and respect safety flags.

2.question: What should I bring?
2.answer: Swimsuit, high SPF sunscreen (50+), hat, sunglasses, sandals, change of clothes and waterproof camera if you have one.

3.question: Are the beaches suitable for children?
3.answer: Yes, especially Copacabana and Ipanema which have calmer waters. Prainha and Joatinga are more rugged and recommended for adults.

4.question: Are there lockers to store belongings?
4.answer: There are no lockers on the beaches, but our guide watches belongings while you enjoy the sea. We recommend not bringing valuables.

trekking.title: Trails & Trekking
trekking.description: Guaranteed adventure in Rio's most famous hills: Morro Dois Irmaos, Pedra Bonita, Pedra do Telegrafo, Pedra da Gavea. Specialized guides and breathtaking views. Connect with the exuberant nature of the Atlantic Forest while conquering the most iconic peaks.

items.0: Rio Trip Vibes Dry Fit shirt

0.question: What is the difficulty level?
0.answer: Varies by route: Pedra do Telegrafo is easy (2h), Dois Irmaos is moderate (3h), Pedra Bonita moderate-high (4h) and Pedra da Gavea is difficult (6h, requires experience).

1.question: What is the best time of year for trekking?
1.answer: April to October is ideal with dry weather and pleasant temperatures. Avoid rainy days for trail safety.

2.question: Do I need previous experience?
2.answer: For easy and moderate routes, no. For Pedra da Gavea we recommend basic mountaineering experience. We always assess the group's physical condition.

3.question: What should I bring?
3.answer: Trekking shoes or sneakers with good grip, athletic wear, small backpack, sunscreen, repellent, cap and at least 1.5 liters of personal water.

4.question: Is there an age limit?
4.answer: Easy routes: from 10 years old. Moderate: from 14 years old. Difficult: over 18 years old. People over 60 require medical evaluation.

boatTour.title: Boat Tours
boatTour.description: Enjoy a day in paradise sailing through Ilha Grande or Arraial do Cabo. Crystal clear water beaches, snorkeling and postcard landscapes. A unique experience to discover the most spectacular islands and coves of the Brazilian coast.

0.question: What is the best time of year for this tour?
0.answer: From October to April the sea is calmer and the waters clearer. July and August may have rough seas but are still viable.

1.question: I get seasick, can I do the tour?
1.answer: We recommend taking motion sickness medication before the tour. Most boats are stable, but the sea can vary.

2.question: Is lunch included?
2.answer: Lunch is optional at additional cost. We offer a menu of fresh seafood or chicken. You can also bring your own food.

3.question: Is there a weight or age limit?
3.answer: Children from 5 years old can participate with supervision. There is no weight limit but boats have maximum capacity for safety.

4.question: Can I bring my own snorkeling equipment?
4.answer: Yes, you can bring your personal equipment. We also provide quality equipment at no additional cost.

yachtVip.title: VIP Yacht Tour
yachtVip.description: Exclusive experience along the coasts of Barra da Tijuca and Copacabana. Music, drinks, professional crew and the best sunset in Rio. Ideal for special celebrations, corporate events or simply an unforgettable luxury experience.

0.question: What is the maximum capacity?
0.answer: Our yachts have capacity for 6-12 people depending on the model. For larger groups, we can coordinate multiple vessels.

1.question: Can it be booked for special events?
1.answer: Yes, we offer packages for birthdays, bachelor parties, marriage proposals, corporate events and more. We include themed decoration.

2.question: What is the ideal time?
2.answer: For spectacular sunsets, we recommend leaving 2-3 hours before dusk. For a full beach day, departures at 10am.

3.question: What additional items can I bring?
3.answer: You can bring additional food and drinks at no charge. We have large refrigerators and a basic kitchen area.

4.question: Is there a bad weather policy?
4.answer: In case of adverse weather conditions, we reschedule at no additional cost or refund 100% of payment.

helicopter.title: Helicopter Tour
helicopter.description: Experience Rio from the sky. A panoramic flight over Christ the Redeemer, Sugarloaf, beaches and mountains. Premium experience with unique and unmatched views that will allow you to appreciate the magnitude of the marvelous city.

items.0: Classic Route (15 min): Christ, Sugarloaf, beaches
items.2: Premium Route (30 min): Complete Rio tour

items.0: HD video of the complete flight

0.question: Is it safe to fly in a helicopter?
0.answer: Absolutely. We operate with highly certified pilots, helicopters with rigorous maintenance and comply with all Brazilian civil aviation regulations.

1.question: Is there a weight limit?
1.answer: Combined passenger weight must not exceed 450kg for safety. Helicopters have capacity for 4-6 passengers depending on model.

2.question: What is the best time to fly?
2.answer: Early mornings offer better visibility. Sunsets are spectacular for photos. Avoid midday hours due to thermal turbulence.

3.question: Can we fly in rain?
3.answer: For safety, flights are cancelled or rescheduled in case of rain, dense fog or strong winds. We offer rescheduling at no cost.

4.question: Can I bring my professional camera?
4.answer: Yes, you can use any photographic equipment. Just make sure to hold it securely. Windows are wide and clean for excellent shots.

0.question: How can I book a tour package?
0.answer: You can book directly through our website by clicking 'Book Now' on the package of your choice, or by contacting our travel advisor via WhatsApp for personalized attention.

1.question: What documents do I need to travel?
1.answer: Documents vary depending on your nationality and destination. Generally you will need: valid passport (minimum 6 months validity), visa if applicable, travel insurance, and booking confirmations. Contact our advisor for specific requirements.

2.question: What is the general cancellation policy?
2.answer: We offer free cancellation up to 72 hours before the trip for most packages. Late cancellations may have 50% charges. In case of force majeure, we reschedule at no additional cost. Review the specific terms of each package.

3.question: Can children or elderly people travel?
3.answer: Yes, most of our tours are suitable for families and elderly people. Some adventure tours have age restrictions for safety. Consult us to adapt the experience to your group's needs.

4.question: Do I need to bring cash?
4.answer: We recommend bringing some cash in the local currency of the destination for small expenses. Most establishments accept cards, but having cash is useful for markets, tips and local transportation.

5.question: What does a tour package generally include?
5.answer: Our packages typically include: transportation, bilingual guide, entrance to main attractions, and scheduled activities. Some include meals and accommodation. Review the details of each package to know the specific inclusions.

6.question: How do I contact the travel advisor?
6.answer: You can contact our travel advisor through WhatsApp by clicking the floating button, or through the contact form on our page. We respond within a maximum of 24 hours.

7.question: Do you offer travel insurance?
7.answer: Yes, we recommend and offer travel insurance options that cover medical assistance, cancellations, and luggage. Consult with your advisor to learn about the options available according to your destination.
